definition: lit. such a fool as to die from holding in one's pee (idiom)/fig. unable to solve a problem due to the inflexibility of one's thinking
pinyin: huo2 ren2 rang4 niao4 bie1 si3

sentences.english: I am too old and too empty now to live much longer without you.
sentences.chinese: 失去了你，我如此衰老，如此空寂，已难久活人世。

sentences.english: Institutional social inequalities existed such as slavery and human sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 一些社会的不平等以及存在，如奴隶和活人献祭。

sentences.english: How many moderns greatly live a person to return Dou however this how many ancient times of rock coffin?
sentences.chinese: 几个现代的大活人还斗不过这几个古代的石头棺材吗？

sentences.english: Most of the living humans walking around are skinny as rails.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的活人枯瘦如柴。

sentences.english: Who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead.
sentences.chinese: 他们必在那将要审判活人死人的主面前交帐。

sentences.english: for the living to the dead?
sentences.chinese: 岂可为活人求问死人呢。

sentences.english: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
sentences.chinese: 活人因自己的罪受罚，为何发怨言呢？

sentences.english: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
sentences.chinese: 为要从深坑救回人的灵魂，使他被光照耀与活人一样。

sentences.english: "A living man and a dead one, " said Zarathustra.
sentences.chinese: “一个活人和一个死人，”查拉图斯特拉说。

sentences.english: Constructing cemeteries for clansmen and cemeteries for persons alive shall be strictly prohibited.
sentences.chinese: 严禁修建宗族墓地和修建活人墓。

sentences.english: After passing living person test, be detected by attentive Changjiang Delta.
sentences.chinese: 在通过活人实验后，被细心的江南发觉。

sentences.english: I mean, presumably, you're ready to try this on humans.
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，大概，你准备好了拿活人试一试吧。

sentences.english: To the Aztecs, human sacrifice was a necessary appeasement to the gods.
sentences.chinese: 对阿芝科特来说，供奉上帝是必须用活人献祭的。

sentences.english: You shall not dwell in tombs made by the dead for the living.
sentences.chinese: 你不应当住在那死人替活人筑造的坟墓里。

sentences.english: You tell me, "Oh there's going to be somebody alive.
sentences.chinese: 你告诉我“未来有个活人是你。

sentences.english: They pell-melled the dead with the living all in one kirk.
sentences.chinese: 他们把死人和活人乱七八糟地混放在一个教堂里。

definition: dead person/(coll.) to die/(of a death) to happen
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
